news uk-news clumsy-puppy-uncontrollable-wobble-wont-"Wobbly staffy puppy looking for forever homeByNia DaltonSpecialist Writer:,  Feb |commentsA Staffordshire bull terrier puppy with an uncontrollable wobble is looking for a special family to spend the winter years of her le with. Ten-month-old Luna is a really sweet girl who was diagnosed with a progressive disease named wobbler syndrome, which causes her to lose balance and coordination.The clumsy rescue dog is completely unaware of her disability and loves running around and jumping up for kisses.She is currently being looked after by a foster carer, but will have toto the kennels at South East Dog Rescue she cannot find a permanent home. Kymm White, founder of SEDR, understands it is a monumental ask, but is desperate for Luna to be rehomed at last.to ourTeamDogs newsletterfor your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Little Luna was surrendered to SEDR in July , after her previous owner’s relationship broke down. She went on to have ious tests which diagnosed her with wobblers syndrome - this means she often slips on floors and easily bumps into things. Kymm hoped Luna could have surgery at the Royal Veterinary College, to slow down her progressive condition, but soon realised that it wasnapost possible. It would involve several months of intensive crate recovery and Luna absolutely detests being in a crate. She will even cause herself severe injury to avoid being in one, Kymm explained.  Without surgery, Luna will have a short le expectancy and will be “very lucky” to hit her third birthday. Kymm describes Luna as a sweet-natured, clumsy girl who has heaps of energy and would do just about anything for a treat and a cuddle. Luna gets very excited when itaposs time to go for a walk and adores human attention. “She jumps up and tries to kiss you - which can be overwhelming with her wobbliness,” Kymm said. Luna is vaccinated, microchipped and spayed, and currently living with a temporary foster carer.She is looking for a permanent, loving and understanding family that has experience of dogs with progressive conditions. The Staffy will need a quiet environment with no young children or cats, and a secure garden and soft space to move around in case she does fall over. Luna would ideally suit someone who can spend a lot of time with her at home, and take her on active walks. “We know that the type of homes suited to take on a dog like Luna are very few and far between, due to her needs and the emotional commitment,” Kymm said. I understand this is monumental, and ask that any potential adopter really considersthey can go through such an emotional roller coaster. Kymm added that le is not fair and said her heart breaks for this sweet girl. The SEDR team are determined to to find Luna a very special home, where her last few years can be full of love, care and dignity.Do you know a dog that desperately needs a home  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsAnimalsRoyal Veterinary CollegeLoveLe expectancyAdoption" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: driver wrong side road left
story: Driver on wrong side of road left dad-of-two for dead after massive crashAdrian Bendell killed Mark Norris and badly injured his teenage passenger when he crashed into them while driving on the wrong side of the road in Fyfield, EssexAdrian Bendells van caught on CCTV after the crash Image: Eastnews Press AgencyByJames Hore:,  Feb |commentsA driver on the wrong side of the road tried to scrap his van after killing a biker. Adrian Bendell crashed into a motorbike being ridden by Mark Norris, , and his teenage pillion passenger.The horric smash killed Mr Norris and left his -year-old passenger with a bleed on the brain, the permanent loss of the use of an arm and pelvic injuries. Bendell fled from the devastating accident in Fyfield, Essex, and took his white Ford Escort van to a scrap yard in a bid to evade justice.But his plan fell apart after it emerged the badly battered van had been captured in dash-cam footage, revealing massive damage where it had been in collision with Mr Norris’ motorbike. Police were able to use the registration details to begin a search for the killer driver.  They got a big breakthrough in the form of a tip-off that Bendell had taken the battered van to be scrapped within hours of the fatal accident. Officers were told the van driver had taken the van there on the same evening as the pm death crash on August , .White Ford vehicle parts were also found in a skip at the scrapyard, whose owner had urged Bendell to hand himself in to the police. A manhunt was launched and Bendell was located and arrested by officers three days after the collision. He was charged with causing death by dangerous driving, causing serious injury by dangerous driving, perverting the course of justice, failing to stop at the scene of a collision, and failing to report a collision.  He admitted all charges, other than perverting the course of justice, at a hearing at Chelmsford Crown Court. Yesterday he also admitted perverting the course of justice and was sentenced to a total of nine years. He was also disqualied from driving for seven-and-a-half years and will be required to take an extended driving test.Inspector Mark Fraser, of Essex Police, said: “Mark Norris was dearly loved by those who knew him and his death has had a massive impact on them.“Adrian Bendell was reckless and his actions after the collision were callous. Rather than stop to try and help Mark and his passenger, he made off, leaving him to die. “His first thought was how he could cover his tracks and dispose of the vehicle.”  Inspector Norris praised his officers for tracking down Bendell, of Braintree, Essex. “Through the dedication of the team working on this case, he was unable to get away with his crime and has now faces justice, he said. “No conviction or sentence can ever bring Mark back but I hope this result will help his family move forward. After Mark’s death last summer his family said: “Mark was a dearly loved and devoted father to Joe and Sara, partner to Helen, son to Jan and friend to everyone that knew him. “Mark was a keen and experienced motorcycle rider and enjoyed everything motor powered.” They said his death had left a huge hole in their hearts.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Essex PoliceCourt caseCrown courtDangerous drivingDriving test" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: first picture popular student 18
story: First picture of popular student, , who died while celebrating end of uni examsGeorge Franks-Herbert, , from Pontyclun in Wales, had a passion for science and acting and worked alongside the likes of Jack Whitehall and Eva Longoria during his young acting careerGeorge Franks-Herbert was described as a kind, caring and shy personByTom BedfordLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb  A first-class student who worked alongside Jack Whitehall and Eva Longoria has died after collapsing on a night out.George Franks-Herbert, , was celebrating the end of exams with friends at Gravity nightclub in Bristol when he became unwell on February . Parents Diane and Peter, from Pontyclun in Wales, were woken by police at am to be told their youngest of four children had died after medics were unable to revive him. Officers said there were no suspicious circumstances and his family have been told that he died from a “medical event”.The biochemistry student was an extra in TV Casualty and had acted alongside Whitehall and Longoria in the BBCaposs Decline and Fall.Mum Diane, , said: “Acting and performing was his hobby. He went to stage school from being very young. “His first stage role was when he was just five months old playing baby Jesus in a church nativity.”Dad Peter, , had also been studying biochemistry at Bristol University, reports Wales Online. The retired biochemist said: “He came home for Christmas and spent the whole time studying for his exams. He was doing very well at university. “George was the baby of the family, that’s why we are going to miss him so much. “He was modest, kind, warm, caring and shy - we’ve had so many messages saying he was a lovely and thoughtful young man. “We are waiting for the post mortem results but we’ve been told it was a medical event. The couple said they travelled to Bristol regularly to take George out for meals as a break from his studies and he made regular trips back home during his first term in the city. Peter said: “He came home every few weeks and we would go and see him. “We have been spending time looking at old photographs and remembering happy times together.” Professor Sarah Purdy, Pro-Vice-Chancellor for Student Experience at Bristol University, paid tribute to George. She said: We are all very sorry to hear about the death of first-year Biochemistry student George Franks-Herbert. On behalf of the University, I would like to offer our sincere condolences to his family and friends at this incredibly dficult time. George was a popular student who had made lots of friends and he was enjoying his time in Bristol. Academically, he was doing really well, thriving in his studies and getting first-class marks. I know this news will affect many of our students and staff deeply. We are in the process of reaching out to George’s friends and those who studied with him to offer our help and support, and we encourage anyone who is affected by this tragic news to contact our wellbeing services for support. George was a member of his local Stagecoach school. A spokesperson for the school said: “George started at Stagecoach as a four-year-old and in July  received his -year award. “George was clever, funny, genuine, good-natured and determined. We are truly grateful to have known, taught and loved him. “He turned  last June and left Stagecoach last summer to go into the world to further his education. “He had such a bright future ahead. title: great grandma electronically tagged after
story: Great-grandma electronically tagged after being caught with drugs in her braLily Gordon, , of Salford, Greater Manchester, hid packages of drugs in her bra and a plant pot in the garden during a police raidLily Gordon outside court with her son Image: MEN MediaByAmy Walker:,  Feb |commentsA great grandmother stashed drugs in her bra during a police raid, a court heard. Lily Gordon lted up her top and removed several packages containing illegal substances when asked by officersshe was hiding anything, a court heard today. The -year-old claimed: I know you won’t believe me but I found them.Officers descended on Gordonaposs Salford home in  and caught the defendant trying to bury a package in a plant pot in her back garden, reports Manchester Evening News. They asked what she was hiding and she replied: Something I found over there. Officers then found three silver-wrapped cannabis resin bars, the court heard.  Three years on from the seizure due to ious delays in the case, Gordon pleaded guilty to possession with intent to supply cannabis and possession of diamorphine. Prosecutor Eleanor Gleeson said that there had been inordinate delays in the case before it made its way to court. “The offences were committed in December , the drugs were sent off for analysis and didn’t come back until April  to confirm they were diamorphine and cannabis,” she said. “There was a further delay until October  which was chased by the CPSand found that simply GMP did not send what was required of them to authorise the charge properly.”  She said the delay continued due to the police not providing the correct evidence and due to inactivity, the case was put to one side. GMP later sent the relevant evidence in September  and over a year later in October , the case was reopened. It later became apparent that part of the delay was due to the officer in the case being on maternity leave. Ms Gleeson said that on December , , officers attended a house on Wall Street, and found Gordon at the back of the home trying to bury something silver into the soil in a plant pot.  “The officer asked aposWhat are you hiding Lilyapos to which she replied: aposSomething over thereapos and pointed towards the bins in the garden,” she said. The officer searched the plant pot and found three silver-wrapped cannabis resin bars. The house was then searched and no drugs were found. Another officer searched Gordon and askedshe had anything on her and she replied “no”. “As the officer began the search, she askedthe defendant had anything inside her bra, Ms Gleeson told the court. “She then lted her bra and removed one larger brown bag and four small bags of a brown substance.“She then said, “I know you won’t believe me but I found them”. They also seized an iPhone, a Nokia and a bank card in her name in her coat pocket. The drugs were analysed and found to be . grams of cannabis and . grams of diamorphine. The cannabis was valued at £., the court heard. Gordon was said to have two previous convictions for five offences, all of which were for possession of cannabis. Mitigating, Jane Miller said she had made continuous efforts to contact the police to find out what was going on in the case over the course of the three years. “During that period she had the expectation that the proceedings were coming her way,” she said. “Also, during this time, her daughter has died. “She is ashamed to be appearing here today in relation to the proceedings.” She said her client has two sons, seven grandchildren and one great-grandchild. Her daughter died in . Sentencing her, Recorder Graham Wells said: “You did try to hide it and you weren’t being initially honest about it right from the start, but you did indicate you were going to plead guilty. “This has taken far, far too long to come to court. “In the meantime, I have read in your pre-sentence report that you have given up smoking cannabis and have tried to put things right.” Gordon, of Liverpool Street, was handed a -month community order, a three-month curfew between pm and am - she was also fined £. title: groom slammed attending wedding bride
story: Groom slammed for attending own wedding to bride, , in jeans and T-shirtBest friend of the bride, Violet Price, , from Doncaster, shared a now-infamous clip on TikTok, showing bride Catherine Nicholson getting married to her casually-attired groomSocial media users have taken issue with the apparent lack of effort behind the mystery groom’s choice of attireByPhoebe Tonks:,  Feb |commentsA groom who turned up for his wedding in a pair of jeans and a t-shirt with a slogan across the front has prompted widespread criticism. Some critics have even askedhe “even knew he was getting married”. TikTok user Violet Price, , shared a now-infamous clip on the , showing her glamorous best friend Catherine Nicholson getting married to her casually-attired groom.According to Yorkshire Live reports, the clip has received more than . million views.Many social media users took issue with the apparent lack of effort behind the mystery groom’s choice of attire. For the celebratory occasion, the groom opted for a black t-shirt from the streetwear brand, Palm Angels, and paired it with grey washed jeans and trainers. His bride Catherine, , went for a more traditional approach and was pictured wearing a white mermaid style wedding gown, complete with cinched waist and a long lace train.  In the video, Catherine and Violet could be seen having fun on a fairground ride while Violet accompanied the footage with the caption: My best friend a couple of months ago telling me she ainapost gunna fall in love. In the accompanying audio, they can also both be heard chanting, I ainapost falling in love this summer, I do my thing this summer in the background, before the video cuts to Catherine on her wedding day, a mere two months later. Several social media users expressed their views too on the speed at which Catherine had taken the marital plunge, with many commenting that it seemed too short a time for such a serious commitment. One person said: Everyone talking about what heaposs wearing but Iaposm thinking how a couple of MONTHS before her wedding she didnapost wanna fall in love… Another suggested the images from the wedding day did not show a beaming bride, saying: Sheaposs not exactly giving happy in love vibes tbf. A third added: Okay but his outfit aside, sis donapost even look happy. Despite the whirlwind romance already drawing some critical comments, many users took more umbrage with the groom’s chosen outfit - and didn’t hold back when sharing their thoughts on the matter. One person asked: Did he not know he was getting married  Another joked: Wedding at . Wetherspoons with the ladsapos at . Noting the effort made by Catherine for the big day, a third said: aposI wouldaposve done a u-turn as soon as I saw him. Imagine putting all the effort into looking beautul  then your aposfiancéapos shows up like THAT  Violet, however, was accepting none of it and hit back at trolls that called into question her friend’s happiness by posting: For god sake stop, sheaposs married and very happy. news uk-news kate-strict-rule-george-charlotte-"Prince George and Princess Charlotte fight over morning musicByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsThe Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are very hands-on when it comes to disciplining their children.As part of their wish to give George, Charlotte and Louis as aposnormalapos upbringings as possible, they lead the way with parenting - unlike royals before them who relied on a team of staff and nannies.The couple are regulars on the school run and love spending quality time with their children - cooking, baking and playing in the garden whenever they can.But Kate and William can also be strict when they need to be, as according to a source, there is one very big rule in their home that they vow to stick to.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . They told the Sun : Shouting is absolutely aposoff limitsapos for the children and any hint of shouting at each other is dealt with by removal.And instead of sending their kids to the naughty step or to their rooms, Kate and William have a apossofa chatapos. The source explained: The naughty child is taken away from the scene of the row or disruption and talked to calmly by either Kate or William. Things are explained and consequences outlined and they never shout at them. But when Kate and William have royal engagements to attend to, their nanny, Maria Borrallo takes over the childcare duties.  Read MoreMaria trained at the prestigious Norland College, in Bath, which is well known for training the caretakers of the UKaposs most notable families.The nannies are taught everything from defensive driving to security issues to how to care for a future king or queen, royal commentator Victoria Murphy told ABC News shortly after the birth of Princess Charlotte.So [Borrallo] just really knows everything that you could possibly need to know about bringing up a child.She was hired by the family back in  when George was just eight months old and now looks after Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis too. She lives in Kensington Palace and travels with the family on visits and royal tours as a discrete presence. Maria is believed to be very strict with the royal children and like all Norland Nannies has a no-nonsense approach.Norland expert Louise Heren told the Sun : There will be no messing. Thataposs because Maria will be aware that as they step off planes, holding mumaposs hands, smiling and waving to the crowds, there canapost be any crying or terrible twos or tantrums. The children have a pm bedtime, which has to be stuck to, and all playtime must take place outside, no matter the weather.Louise said: Lots of bike rides, playing with their dogs, potentially some gardening. Norland are very into teaching children through play. If it is tipping down, they will still go out. Wet weather is just inappropriate clothing, you have to put the right stuff on.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: making spotify playlists partner more
story: Making Spoty playlists for partner more romantic than buying flowers, poll findsA poll carried out by mobility app FREE NOW found that waiting to watch your favourite TV shows with the person you love is more likely to impress them than sending them lettersMaking a Spoty playlist for the person you love is seen as a romantic gesture Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Feb |comments Making Spoty playlists for the one you love is seen as more romantic than buying them flowers, a poll has found. When it comes to modern romance, waiting to watch your favourite TV shows together is more likely to impress them than sending love letters.Almost a third of those who responded to the poll said the height of romance was using a picture of your loved one as your phone screen saver, while less than a fth said it was sending them roses. Top of the list was checking someone is home after a night out, with % saying it was the best way of showing someone you care. Travelling miles to be with them was next, followed by sending messages first thing in the morning and last thing at night.  While love letters are on the wane communication is still key to romance – it just takes a dferent form.High on the most-wanted list were regular videocalls when apart, regularly sending funny memes and never leaving someone hanging on a WhatsApp double tick.And sharing your TV streaming password is the best way of saying “I love you” for % of those polled. Newcastle was found to be the UK’s most romantic city, with % of Geordies considering themselves true romantics, compared with a national average of %. Liverpool and Nottingham followed close behind but Bristol was revealed as the least romantic place in the survey of , by mobility app FREE NOW. Mariusz Zabrocki of FREE NOW said: “It is not necessarily the big grand gestures but smaller touches that signal you are love-struck.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON AppsLoveRomanceDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news mike-tindalls-sneaky-text-kate-"Kate Middleton hoisted high up in air during rugby trainingByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Feb |comments Mike Tindall has joked how he wanted the Duchess of Cambridge to mess up when she took to the rugby pitch so he could tease her on the family WhatsApp group.Kate showed off her skills and was lted in a lineout at Twickenham last week after becoming patron of the England Rugby Football Union and Rugby Football League. But former England rugby player Mike, who is married to Prince Williamaposs cousin Zara, had to admit Kate looked effortless as she joined in a training session alongside players such as Leicester Tigers prop Ellis Genge. Speaking on his podcast The Good, The Bad and The Rugby, Mike admitted: I text Ellis and said ‘mate, please tell me anything she messed up on’ so I could sort of, family WhatsApp group, get into her.  “And he said ‘No she was actually pretty good, and she was really good at kicking’ and I was like…” Mike proceeded to give a large sigh and added: But she has this competitive nature where she has to be good at things.” His co-presenter Alex Payne agreed, saying: “She looked unbelievably natural.” And Mike added: Just imagine, anyone who’s ever tried it, getting thrown up in the line-outyou’ve never done it before is not easy because normally, you’ll kick the prop in either the nuts or the face as he’s lting you and she just looked effortless.”Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. The ex-player also joked: “The best thing is when it rolls to England and Wales, we get the battle of the Cambridges.”It was revealed last week that Kate had taken on the two royal rugby roles, which were previously held by Prince Harry. He had to give them up when he and we Meghan Markle stepped down as working royals. Kate had been tipped to take on both jobs and confirmed her new duties in a video, which showed her throwing a rugby ball to dferent players. At one point even spins the ball on her finger. Meanwhile, Kate’s new affiliation with England rugby puts her in direct competition with husband William, who is the Welsh Rugby Union’s patron. William and Kate, already known for their rivalry on sporting engagements, are expected to attend some England and Wales games during the current Six Nations tournament. title: mum kids hide bathroom ex
story: Mum and kids hide in bathroom as ex smashes window and smears blood through homeGregorz Ewiak, , was jailed for two years and four months and a restraining order is now in force to protect his victimGregorz Ewiak was jailed after he broke into exs home in Warrington Image: Liverpool Echo WSByNeil DockingLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Feb |commentsA mum hid in a locked bathroom with her children while her ex-boyfriend smashed through their home and smeared blood across the walls, a court heard. Gregorz Ewiak, , broke into the victimaposs home by crashing through the living room window and later threatened to kill her, it was claimed. Like a horror movie, blood was discovered on the TV, walls, carpets and door handles which revealed Ewiakaposs DNA, the prosecution said.When the terrying ordeal was over, he sent her a text threatening to take away her children, aged two and seven, reports Liverpool Echo.A judge told Ewiak his actions must have left the victim and her children absolutely petried.Liverpool Crown Court was told the female victim was at her home in Birchwood, Warrington, on October  last year.Ewiak, of Dagenham, London, was subject to bail conditions at the time, with an overnight home curfew due to extradition proceedings.  But the mum heard banging on her front door at around pm, before her living room window was smashed. She rushed upstairs, collected her children from their bedrooms and locked them in the bathroom with her. Prosecutor Jonathan Rogers said: She could then hear people in her home and she heard someone shout aposIaposm going to kill youapos in Polish. She didnapost recognise the voice but someone allegedly started banging on the bathroom door trying to get in. Neighbours called the police and the two intruders left the scene, the court heard. When officers arrived, they found the front door lock was broken, with the key snapped in the lock. Mr Rogers said they discovered large amounts of blood by the living room window and smeared throughout the property which revealed Ewiakaposs DNA. The prosecutor said the woman told a social worker Ewiak had confronted her a few weeks earlier suspecting she was having a relationship with a next-door neighbour. Ewiak was arrested and interviewed - but made no comment. He admitted burglary with intent to cause damage and criminal damage, after a charge of making threats to kill was dropped by the crown. Mr Rogers said Ewiakaposs victim concluded a statement by saying she is scared of the defendant because he is crazy. He said: She is unsure of what he may do and she believes the safest thing for her to do is toto Poland. The victim also wrote a letter to the court, but later said this was after being pressured into doing so, by two unknown iniduals. Recorder Ian Harris said the victim explained a letter was sent to the court in my name requesting a lenient sentence for Mr Ewiak and said the letter was made under duress. Ewiak has four previous convictions including theft in  and advertising prostitution in . In  he was jailed for battery after assaulting a former partner. That same year he was jailed for  months in Poland for inflicting grievous bodily harm. The court heard a letter from the mum of his child described him as a good father to their daughter and there was a letter from his daughter saying how much she misses her father. Benjamin Brown, defending, asked for full one-third credit for his clientaposs early guilty pleas and said he had no knowledge of the letter sent by the victim. He said: He accepts that he clearly should never have entered the property and he does recognise the impact upon his ex-partner. Mr Brown said: His sole focus and motivation now your honour is to become a good father to his daughter, who is  years of age. He fully appreciates and keenly feels the loss to her of a father figure as a result of his actions. The lawyer said Ewiak wanted to take up a job offer at a vegetable shop. He said: The defendant wants to become a beneficial member of society moving forward and is motivated to gain employment upon his release. Reading a pre-sentence report, Recorder Harris said: He only accepted limited responsibility for his offending and he doesnapost come across as being particularly remorseful. Mr Brown suggested language barriers may have contributed to that impression. Recorder Harris said the victim and her children must have been absolutely petried when locked in the bathroom. The judge said the sight of all the blood afterwards must have added horror to the fear that the woman and the children felt. He said Ewiak travelled up from Dagenham and when he arrived at the house, it seems to me there was an explosion of temper so far as youaposre concerned. Recorder Harris jailed him for two years and four months, adding: This is without prejudice to the extradition matter that as I understand it is going through the courts. He also imposed a seven-year restraining order to protect the victim.Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON BirchwoodCourt caseCriminal damageCrown courtSocial workersCrimeBurglary" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: national lottery voucher offer deal
story: Get a £ voucher* for the UKs best attractions using a National Lottery ticketYou can use a Lotto ticket to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractionsAdvertorialByDave MastersDigital Commercial Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Feb Whether you’re eight or , exploring new places brings out the adventurer inside us all.And in the UK we’re spoiled for choice, with hundreds of incredible attractions to fire up the imagination.Thrill seekers of all ages will find adrenaline-filled rides at Zip World or Legoland. Those who prefer a more relaxing experience can enjoy autumn’s spectacular show of colours at venues like Kew Gardens, Cardf Castle or RHS Garden Bridgewater – a major horticultural project near Salford. History fans will adore a trip to the gothic ruins at Whitby Abbey, Warwick or Stirling Castle, while animal lovers can meet Ruby the red panda, born in July at Edinburgh Zoo, or three adorable tiger cubs at Highland Wildle Park. Click here toabout National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*. And you can use a Lotto ticket purchased on or after October ,  to claim a £ voucher* to redeem when booking any one of hundreds of attractions. Not only will you enjoy a discounted day trip, you can feel proud that you’ve helped fund many of the tourist and heritage sites that make the UK unique. By playing The National Lottery, you raise £million for good causes every week.  National Lottery players have supported  of the top  most visited tourist attractions in the UK**, from castles to wildle parks, botanical gardens to museums and plenty of other fun stuff. Every adventure starts with a finger on a map. So where will yours land Highland Wildle Park: Meet animals from all over the worldGet up close to some endangered animals from the world’s mountains and tundra in the stunning setting of the Cairngorms National Park. From the comfort of your car you’ll encounter bison, elk and red deer – then visit the tigers and polar bears on foot using the park’s trails. Many nativeanimals are here too, including the capercaillie, European grey wolf, wolverine, lynx, Scottish wildcat and beavers. Cardf Castle: Enjoy a great day in history It has a history that stretches back to Roman times, a keep dating from the Norman Conquest, a spectacular moat and great views over the city that sits just beside it. Cardf Castle makes for one brilliant family day out. You’ll learn that it was once home to the world’s richest man, and was used as a giant air raid shelter during the Nazi bombardment of the city. Kids will love standing beside the huge replica trebuchet – a six-ton medieval weapon built for a movie that was filmed at the castle. After you’ve toured the building, stroll around its beautul grounds, or explore the city itself.Stonehenge: Explore this wonderful World Heritage Site Get close to this mysterious monument that dates back nearly , years. This awe-inspiring embodiment of human ingenuity offers a direct connection to our ancient past, and is a bucket-list destination for visitors around the world. Click here toabout the National Lottery Days Out and redeem your £ voucher*.  *Subject to availability. One voucher per person. + only. See NationalLotteryDaysOut for full TsCs.**Source: the Association of Leading Visitor Attractions, . title: next full moon 2022 full
story: When is the next full moon in   Full lunar calendar including dates and peak timesThere are  full moons to enjoy in . Here is everything you need to know, including dates, nicknames and what time they peakThere are  full moons in  Image: REUTERSByAriane Sohrabi-ShirazSEO Editor:,  Feb |commentsEvery year a number of full moons grace our skies - and there is plenty to look forward to in  – including Supermoons and total lunar eclipses. The moon takes . days to circle the planet, also known as a lunar cycle, which means a full moon takes places on a slightly dferent date each month. That means there is usually one full moon a month, although sometimes there is more than one – also known as a Blue Moon. This year there will be  full moons, including two big and bright Supermoons, and two moons that will line up with the sun to create a total lunar eclipse.Here are the dates of the  full moons for . When is the next full moon in    The next full moon of  falls on February . Here is a full lunar calendar for , their nicknames and what time they will peak.January  - Wolf MoonFebruary  - Snow moonMarch  - Worm MoonApril  - Pink MoonMay  - Flower MoonJune  – Strawberry MoonJuly  Buck MoonAugust  – Sturgeon MoonSeptember  – Corn MoonOctober  – Hunteraposs MoonNovember  – Beaver MoonDecember  – Cold Moon When are the Supermoons and lunar eclipses   There are two Supermoons and two total lunar eclipses in . The first total lunar eclipse calls on May . This phenomenon happens when Earth lines up directly between the Sun and the Moon. When this happens the Earthaposs shadow covers the moon, causing the Moon to turn red when it reaches totality. The next total lunar eclipse falls on November . This happens two weeks after October aposs solar eclipse. The first Supermoon will fall on July . This phenomenon occurs when the Moonaposs orbit is closestto Earth at the same time as a full Moon. The closest point is an average distance of , miles from Earth. This means that moon will appear brighter and larger than usual. The second Supermoon will fall on July . What other moon phenomena are there  Blue Moon  In addition to Supermoons and total lunar eclipses, there are also Blue Moons. A Blue Moon means two moons occur within one calendar month. Despite the name, the Blue Moon isnapost actually blue. You may have heard the term once in a blue moon, which has come to mean a notably rare event. However, Blue Moons actually happen relatively regularly – every two to three years on average. Blood Moon A total lunar eclipse is also known as a Blood Moon, because when it happens the moon turns a reddish colour. This is due to the fact that sunlight bends through the Earthaposs atmosphere. The Moon orbits around Earth, taking around  days to complete a cycle, while the Earth orbits the Sun, going through a . day cycle. Lunar eclipses happen because the Moon orbits in a slightly dferent plane than the Earth and Sun do – however, at times their planes coincide. During a lunar eclipse, Earth passes between the Moon and the Sun, cutting off the sunlight. Space explains: During a full eclipse, however, something spectacular happens. The moon is fully in Earthaposs shadow. At the same time, a little bit of light from Earthaposs sunrises and sunsetsfalls on the surface of the Moon. Because the light waves are stretched out, they look red. When this red light strikes the moonaposs surface, it also appears red. title: prince charles testing positive again
story: Prince Charles testing positive again reminds us Covid pandemic is not overPrince Charles has contracted Covid- for a second time. It is hoped he has not passed it on to the Queen. The Palace said she is not showing symptoms and she is expected to take daily testsPrince Charles has tested positive for Covid- for a second time Image: Getty ImagesopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Feb |comments We wish Prince Charles a speedy recovery from coronavirus.The fact he has contracted it a second time is a reminder the pandemic is far from over. Tens of thousands are still coming down with the virus every day and, just as Charles will hope he has not passed it on to the Queen, they too will worry about spreading it. So Boris Johnson must explain why he unilaterally decided to bring forward the end of all Covid restrictions. One member of SAGE has said they were blindsided by the decision even though it has implications for millions of people’s health. It is also noticeable that neither the Chief Medical Officer, Sir Chris Whitty, nor the Chief Scientic Adviser, Sir Patrick Vallance, have said whether they approve of the PM’s actions. People will rightly ask whether the Prime Minister is acting in the national interest or out of political expediency.  Fools rush in Everything must be done to prevent Russia from carrying out its threat to invade Ukraine. Vladimir Putin is playing a reckless and risky game by massing an estimated , Russian troops on the country’s border. The response from the West must be resolute and united. But there is a fine line between taking a firm stance against Russian aggression and inflaming an already delicate situation. Boris Johnson’s overblown rhetoric yesterday risked crossing that line. President Putin is deliberately testing the resolve of the West. Forcing him to back down requires careful and well-calibrated diplomacy, not cavalier comments and photo opportunities designed to distract attention from domestic troubles. LveYu Sending flowers and writing love letters have fallen out of fashion. Now love means sharing your streaming password and compiling a Spoty playlist. Next young lovebirds will be asking Alexa: “Is romance really dead ” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Boris JohnsonPrince Charles, Prince of WalesVladimir PutinLoveRoyal FamilyPoliticsCoronavirusDaily Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news queen-facing-days-covid-tests-"Prince Charles tests positive for Covid and is self-isolatingByRussell MyersRoyal Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments The Queen is being closely monitored and faces days of Covid tests after it was revealed she met Prince Charles just two days before he tested positive for coronavirus.Buckingham Palace tonight refused to confirm whether the -year-old monarch had tested positive or negative, fuelling fears for her health, but palace sources insisted she was not displaying symptoms of the virus. Palace doctors will now test the Queen frequently after she saw her son at her Windsor Castle home on Tuesday, it is understood. The Prince of Wales, , is self isolating at home after testing positive after a routine test this morning, forcing him to pull out of a joint engagement in Winchester with we Camilla. Aides confirmed the future king was “not experiencing strong symptoms”, but the Duchess of Cornwall revealed he was finding the situation “a bit tiresome”. It is the second time the heir to the throne has contracted the virus, first doing so in March  when he had mild symptoms and lost his sense of smell and taste.Riding solo for a series of meetings today Camilla said she was feeling “lucky” to have not caught the virus. The Queen has been triple-vaccinated so will not need to self isolate, unless she tests positive. She received her first jab in January  and her second jab in March while sources say it is believed she got her booster jab in October. Buckingham Palace aides said they would not comment on the Queen’s personal health, but a palace source said “obviously the situation will be closely monitored”. The Queen is understood to be “feeling much better” recently after regaining her health after a torrid few months. She was forced to spend the night in hospital in October after receiving treatment for an unexplained condition.  Doctors ordered her to take a period of rest after she completed a relentless schedule of  engagements in as many days. The monarch then missed the Remembrance Sunday service at the Cenotaph in London in November after spraining her back.Throughout the pandemic, the Queen has largely been shielded by a ring of steel dubbed ‘HMS Bubble’, whereby  royal staff sacriced their home lives to stay isolated at Windsor Castle so they could serve the Queen and her late husband Prince Philip during lockdown.A year later, in April , strict Covid regulations meant the Queen was forced to wear a mask and sit alone as she attended husband Prince Philip’s funeral. In recent weeks she has been enjoying her freedom after making a trip to Sandringham, her Norfolk estate, to mark the anniversary of her father’s death and dau of her accession to the throne on Feb . The Queen was out and about on public duties on Saturday, the eve of her record-breaking Platinum jubilee, meeting charity workers at Sandringham House - her first major public appearance in more than three months. A source close to the Queen tonight said she was “not experiencing any symptoms” but her contact with Charles was “recently enough to be relevant”. The prince went to see his mother on Tuesday at Windsor Castle after awarding OBEs to chefs Fergus Henderson, who has Parkinson’s Disease, and his we Margot as well as an MBE to Dr Nisreen Alwan, who is known for campaigning for more awareness around long covid.On Wednesday evening he attended with Camilla a reception for the British Asian Trust with  guests, including Chancellor Rishi Sunak and Home Secretary Priti Patel at the British Museum in London on Wednesday evening. The heir can be released from his isolationhe tests negative on day  and day  and does not have a temperature. The triple-vaccinated prince was said to be “deeply disappointed” to have to pull out of engagements in Winchester after his positive test on Thursday. When he contracted covid for the first time last March he said he ”got away with it quite lightly” before spending seven days in self-isolation at his Birkhall home in Scotland before resuming his duties.Downing Street said Prime Minister Boris Johnson wished the prince a “speedy recovery”.On a solo visit to the Thames Valley Partnership in Buckinghamshire, Camilla said she was lucky not to be positive herself.  Speaking to Willie Hartley Russell, high sherf for Berkshire, during the visit today, she said: “He’s diagnosed now. Luckily . I’ve taken it so many times.” Mr Hartley Russell said: “It gets a bit pointless, doesn’t it ” and Camilla agreed. Speaking afterwards, he added: “She said, ‘Yes, unfortunately he had tested positive again. I said he must be building up lots of antibodies. “She said something like he’s finding it a bit tiresome to have got it again, but she said it in a light-hearted way.”  Earlier in the day, Camilla spoke for the first time to reveal her delight at the Queen’s statement on Saturday that it was her “sincere wish” that the Duchess of Cornwall be made ‘Queen Consort’ when Charles takes the throne. On a visit to the Nourish Hub community food centre in West London, Camilla was asked about how she feels about her future title. And in reply she said she was “very, very honoured” and “very touched” to receive the Queen’s backing to be a future Queen Consort. story: Set for Le results: National Lottery draw with huge £,-a-month jackpotIf you win tonights draw you can plan that very exciting holiday, buy that dream car or even move to the house youve been thinking of. The National Lottery draw sees lucky winners scoop £, a month for  years. While even the runners up - who match the five main numbers - can land themselves £, a month for a year. title: tea loving grandfather 73 laid
story: Tea-loving grandfather, , laid to rest beside flowers box of his favourite brewLeslie Keith Dee, , was known to drink up to  mugs of tea a day. When he passed away, his family honoured him by placing a floral tribute to Yorkshire Tea by his gravesideThe Yorkshire Tea floral tribute for Leslie Keith Dee Image: Chad Dee   SWNSByAdam AspinallNews Reporter:,  Feb |comments A tea-loving ex-builder was laid to rest beside a box of his favourite brew made out of flowers at his funeral. Leslie Keith Dee, , was known to drink up to  mugs of tea a day – strong, with a dash of milk and two sugars – and was rarely seen without some of the hot stuff in hand.So when the retired bricklayer passed away aged  on January , his family honoured him by placing a floral tribute to the brand by his graveside. Chad Dee, , one of Leslie’s  grandchildren, said the display commemorated the character of the fondly missed family man as well as his love of Yorkshire Tea. Leslie, from Gloucester, developed his love of tea while working on building sites.  Chad said: “On a cold building site, most of them would drink tea to warm them up by the flask.” Even when Leslie was forced to spend more time at home due to a hip replacement in , his family would always ensure tea was flowing. “Grandad had nine kids and he had  grandkids,” said Chad. “So someone would walk in and flick the kettle on. “He’d sometimes cough and so ‘Oh my throats dry’, as then we’d have to make him a cup!  “He was caring and kind. He’d do anything for his children and grandchildren.” Made by Plantation Florist the tribute was made out of real flowers – in the signature green and red Yorkshire Tea colours – that were woven into a tea box-shaped frame. Chad, who laid the floral tribute at the graveside during the funeral –attended by  people on January  –said he believed it was one of the first of its kind. He said: “When we came up with the idea, I Googled ‘Yorkshire tea tribute’ and there was nothing.” Yorkshire Tea, which has been produced by the Bettys  Taylors Group since , turned to Hollywood and Game of Thrones star Sean Bean to advertise its tea bags. The popular hot drink giant has the slogan “Where everything’s done proper”. news uk-news three-missed-opportunities-catch-ian-"Ian Stewart guilty: Moment double-killer was arrestedByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb Ian Stewart almost got away with his vicious crimes -it hadnapost been for his weaposs wish to donate her brain to medical science.This simple wish exposed her partner as a murderer who had operated in the shadows with little suspicion. Now Stewart, , who was already serving a le term for killing childrenaposs author Helen in  was additionally convicted yesterday of murdering we, Diane, six years earlier. His chilling intentions were uncovered too late - to the fury of many, who have askedhe could have been stopped beforehand. Stewart, , killed -year-old childrenaposs book author Helen in  and dumped her body in the cesspit of the £. million home they shared in Royston in Hertfordshire. He had secretly drugged and suffocated her in a plot to inherit her £m fortune. A trial at St Albans Crown Court heard it was most likely she was suffocated while sedated by drugs, and Stewart was found guilty of her murder in .  His conviction prompted police to reopen their investigation into the death of his we, Diane Stewart,  - and crucial evidence uncovered the truth. It was originally believed that she had died from a sudden epileptic fit in the garden of the coupleaposs home in Cambridgeshire. But examinations of her brain years later uncovered the truth as brain tissue showed signs of suffocation, with prosecutors suggesting Stewart could have forced a plastic bag over her head. Now questions are being asked about why he was free to murder Helen after signs of foul play were allegedly missed in Dianeaposs death.Speaking to The , Shelley Whitehead who befriended Helen said: aposIt really raises questions about how someone so very evil could literally get away with murder, and do it again.aposDid they look at this bereaved, vulnerable father, this man whose we has aposdiedapos from an epileptic fit, the father who now has to raise his boys on his own - is he so convincing that they didnapost do the proper checks  Or was something overlooked apos  Epilepsy Questions have been raised over whether anything was missed in the original investigation of the murder of Diane Stewart. Though she had epilepsy, she hadnapost suffered a fit for  years and controlled her condition with medication. But her husband claimed he ed from a shopping trip to find her collapsed after hanging up washing. At the trial, an expert claimed her chances of suffering a fatal epileptic fit were about one in , Yet, this was originally recorded as her cause of death, with an inquest concluding she had suffered a sudden death in epilepsy , which kills about  people each year.  Coroners inquest According to the coroneraposs file that was seen by The , pathologists carried out a non-forensic post-mortem examination and recommended epilepsy as the cause of death,aposno toxicological or anatomical causeapos was found. This was reached despite no tell-tale signs of a fit, such as evidence of tongue biting or physical injuries matching the claim she had fallen onto a concrete patio, as her killer claimed. Full toxicology tests were not carried out during the examination in  - with screenings only carried out for an anti-epileptic drug. A decade on, experts found physiological changes in her brain known as ischemia as a result of suffocation, rather than the so-called epileptic fit. This could have ruled out a sudden death - as it develops over time and indicated she was unconscious for some time before her death.  CPR claims Stewartaposs claim that he performed CPR was doubted by a paramedic who found no evidence of blood or froth on his face - which there would have beenhe had attempted it. During a  call, he was instructed to perform mouth-to-mouth and claimed he was doing so, but paramedic Spencer North, who attended the scene, said there “didn’t seem to be any effective CPR”. There were also no signs of injuries caused by CPR - or even cuts or bruises on Diane, which youaposd expectsheaposd collapsed on the concrete patio as claimed. Speaking to the BBC, neighbour Vanessa Easton, a nurse, recalled arriving home and seeing Dianeaposs body.I remember thinking at the time aposthank goodness thereaposs no blood... she looks perfectapos. Speaking to the BBC yesterday, Det Supt Kent acknowledged there were suspicious factorsyou compare them to what happened to Helen Bailey. Of course we didnapost have that information or evidence at that stage, he said. At the time of Dianeaposs death there was nothing to suspect that Ian had been responsible or that she had died at his hands. title: uks top 10 most nicked
story: UKs top  most nicked cars in  - where is yours on the list The DVLA says more than , cars were stolen in Britain in , with Fords, Vauxhalls, Land Rovers and Mercedes vehicles the most popular among thievesThe DVLA says there were thefts of , motors in , Image: Getty ImagesByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Feb |comments Ford drivers beware, thieves stole more of the American make’s cars last year than any other, stats show.The Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agencysays there were thefts of , motors in , an increase from  when there were ,. And the most targeted vehicles were Ford Fiestas, with , disappearing from driveways and roads. Focuses were the third most stolen with , going missing.The second most nicked were Land Rover Range Roverswith VW Golfs in fourthand Mercedes-Benz C-Classin fth, according to Mail Online.Clive Wain, head of police liaison for Tracker, told the publication the increase in car thefts was likely pandemic related. He said: “The lack of parts for new car manufacturing resulted in a surge of sales in the second-hand car market, creating a lucrative business for car thieves to fill the shortage.  “Prestige models have always been the go-to for criminals who exploit the demand for these desirable cars in territories like Europe, Middle East and Africa. “We are continuously intercepting shipping containers packed with stolen vehicles at ports around the country and  was no dferent. However, due to the pandemic lower value cars have also seen an increase in theft rates.” The rest of the top  cars stolen last year were BMW  Series , Land Rover Discovery , Vauxhall Corsa , Vauxhall Astraand Mercedes-Benz E-Class . LeaseLoco chief executive John Wilmot said the figures show just how important it is for people to take extra precautions to securely lock their car. He said: The Ford Fiesta may be about to lose its title as the best selling car in the UK but it still retains the unenviable title as the most stolen car in Britain.  “While the Range Rover Sport, one of the most popular luxury SUVs on the market, has been targeted by sophisticated criminal gangs who have the knowledge and keyless tech to gain entry. He said: If you take the right precautions you can avoid becoming a victim of car thieves - and that goes for any car owners. Always make sure your car is locked before you walk away and check that it’s locked at night. Think about upgrading the security on your car this could include fitting an alarm, immobiliser and tracking system. title: adidas divides public opinion page
story: Adidas ides public opinion with page -esque advert with topless womenThe sportswear company Adidas shared the eye-popping ad on its official Twitter page, with a grid of  women’s torsos accompanied by the message: “We believe women’s breasts in all shapes and sizes deserve support and comfort”Adidas shared the eye-popping ad on its official Twitter page featuring  bare-chested women Image: Derby ByAlice Peacock:,  Feb |commentsSportswear giant Adidas has ided public opinion with an ad campaign for a new line of female sports bras - which features  faceless womenaposs breasts. The company shared the eye-popping ad on its official Twitter page, on Wednesday afternoon, with a grid of  women’s torsos accompanied by the message: “We believe women’s breasts in all shapes and sizes deserve support and comfort”. “Which is why our new sports bra range contains  styles, so everyone can find the right fit for them.”The ad invites customers to explore the new bra collection online and used the hashtag #SupportIsEverything.The ad has generated a substantial amount of buzz on social media, from both those in support of the “body positive” advertising and from those questioning the motive.“@adidas what the hell ! Leave something to the imagination,” one critic wrote.“There are kids on Twitter.”Another person criticised the company for showing a lack of ersity in the image. “I’m all for boobies and positivity but like…what are they selling ” they wrote. “Shouldn’t it at least show how their “body-positive” bras support all dferent kinds of boobies Or is this just another shock ad designed only to generate revenue by using women’s bodies  Exhausting.” Another cheekily commented: “Maybe show the bras actually supporting the tits ” This isn’t page  hun.”  In another twist, the official Playboy Twitter account commented its support, tweeting: “This is the breast ever!” However, others commended the bold advertisement, lauding the image as being a great piece of body positive content. “My we is one of the women who volunteered to be photographed for this new Adidas campaign,” one person wrote. “At first I was very uncomfortable with it but my we  her sisters sat me down  taught me the importance of body positivity  female autonomy. I now understand  support Adidas.” Another Twitter user weighed in with some more positivity, saying the advertisement “excites [her] so much”. “Both from a body positivity perspective and from a fact it’s sooooo dficult to find a proper fitting sports bra!” she wrote. The Mirror has approached Adidas for comment.Shares of Adidas were up by around % near the close of trading on Wall Street on Wednesday local time, theNY Post reported. title: dad posts smiling selfie kids
story: Dad posts smiling selfie with kids,  and , an hour before murder-suicideHumberto Christian To, , posted a smiling selfie with his two children, aged  and nine, on Facebook before shooting them both dead and then taking his own le in Miami Lakes, Florida, USAHumberto Christian To killed his kids and then took his own le Image: FacebookByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb  A orced dad-of-two posted a smiling selfie with his kids on Facebook just an hour before shooting them and dead and taking his own le.Humberto Christian To appeared happy in the snap with beaming Valeria, , and Matias, nine, taken in his car in Miami Lakes, Florida, USA. But soon after, the -year-old and his children were dead. The kidsapos mum Jessica Forero Cardona came upon the scene by a canal around pm on Tuesday and desperately tried to resuscitate her son and daughter. Her screams were said to reverberate through the quiet neighbourhood. To and we of  years Jessica orced in August last year. Toaposs mum Luz Kuznitz told Local  News : He was dealing with bipolarity. He didnapost take his pills.He never took care of it. He never wanted to take medication therapy. She added that her son - who worked at City Bikes in Aventura - was a keen cyclist and would often bike to help relieve stress.  Luz said she once askedhe was capable of harming his children and he said: No, never, absolutely not. Jessica had become worried as it got later into the evening and she hadnapost heard from her children, as they had school the next day. To had picked them up from her house earlier, according to Miami-Dade police.  She later found their bodies on some grass next to a concrete bench.The Miami-Dade Police Director Alfredo aposFreddyapos Ramirez III confirmed the deaths on Twitter, writing: Earlier this evening, officers responded to the scene of a shooting where a father senselessly shot and killed his -year-old daughter and nine-year-old son before killing himself. A GoFundMe has been set up, aiming to raise ,to help Jessica afford the funeral costs and mental healthcare. Madga Peñaaposs Ring doorbell picked up the motheraposs cries.She told WSVN : I just opened the door and I ran. My son ran behind me. He didnapost even have shoes.I ran across the grass and when I got there I saw the ladylike on top of the little boy. I couldnapost see the dad or the daughter because of the darkness at first.  Magda went on to describe to NBC  Miami how Jessica pulled the childrenaposs bodies together in her efforts to do chest compressions on them both.At that point, I was crying already, I think I went into shock cause I was just like freaked out, I donapost know, she said. Magda also helped with compressions and said she saw the gun lying on the ground. The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. title: man takes life after accidentally
story: Man takes own le after accidentally shooting brother as he tried to kill bearPolice deputies were dispatched to a property in an unincorporated community in Oregon, US, to reports a man had accidentally shot his brother while loading a gun after being startled by a black bearA man is said to have been startled by a bear before accidentally shooting his brother Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Feb |comments A man took his own le after accidentally shooting dead his brother while loading his gun to kill a black bear.Police found both bodies after being alerted to the incident in Josephine County, Oregon, US, during an emergency call on Tuesday morning. The bear is said to have got onto the rural property, which sits in a gulch just south of wooded hills when the unnamed man took up a firearm and was startled.Josephine County Sherfaposs Office undersherf Travis Snyder said in a statement a  call was received just before am on February  to report the initial shooting in Placer Road, Sunny Valley.The area is an unincorporated community off Interstate  about  miles north of Grants Pass, reports the Oregonian. The caller reported that he had accidentally shot his brother while loading a gun because there was a bear on their property, Mr Snyder said. Upon arrival, Deputies located a deceased male from an apparent gunshot wound.  While checking the rest of the residence, a second deceased male was located with what appeared to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The undersherf went on to say local detectives were being assisted by detectives from the Oregon State Police. He added: Based upon the investigation, it is believed the caller took his own le after calling  to report the accidental shooting.  This case is still under investigation and will be forwarded to the Oregon State Medical Examiner’s Office. The state in the Pacic Northwest region of the Western US is home to around , black bears, according to the Josephine County Parks Department. The department - which calls Oregon aposBlack Bear Countryapos - warns residents to avoid leaving food and litter unsecured and to slowly walk awayconfronted by a bear. It adds that bear attacks are uncommon and the animals generally avoid human contact. It remains unclear whether the bear in Placer Road was acting aggressively. Education Fund to Stop Gun Violence says almost  people are killed in unintentional firearm injuries in the US every year. Americans are four times more likely to die from unintentional gun injuries than those living in other high-income countries, it adds. The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. You matter. title: scientists uncover evidence dinosaurs necks
story: Scientists uncover evidence dinosaurs with necks stretching m long caught coldsScientists from the Great Plains Dinosaur Museum in Montana believe that the bone of a young sauropod found in  shows that some ancient reptiles suffered from coughs, breathing trouble and a feverAn artists impression of a mighty sauropod Image: Corbin RainboltByMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Feb |comments Scientists have found a long-necked dinosaur they believe was suffering a cold-like illness.The young sauropod probably experienced similar symptoms to humans when struck down with a respiratory infection. Big sauropods could have s stretching more than m, which would likely have been quite uncomfortable when suffering from a cough, breathing trouble and fever. The remains are the first evidence of respiratory infection in a non-avian dinosaur. The specimen, which has been nicknamed aposDollyapos, was discovered in Montana in  and dates back to the Late Jurassic Period, around  million years ago. Cary Woodruff and colleagues from the Great Plains Dinosaur Museum in Montana looked at three bones from Dollyaposs neck and found never-before-seen abnormal bony protrusions.  Each bone, which had an unusual shape and texture, would have been attached to air-filled structures, known as air sacs. These connected to the lungs and formed part of the dinosauraposs respiratory system.Scans of unusual protrusions on the bone suggest that they most likely formed in response to an infection. Part of the abstract of the study reads: While we cannot pinpoint the specic infectious agent that caused the airsacculitis, this diagnosis establishes the first fossil record of this disease. Additionally, it allows us increased insight into the medical disorders of dinosaurs from a phylogenetic perspective and understanding what maladies plagued the aposfearfully great lizardsapos.  The scientists have wagered that Dolly was suffering from a fungal infection similar to aspergillosis, a common respiratory illness that affects birds and reptiles. They believe itaposs possible that Dolly died as a result of the infection. Given the likely symptoms this animal suffered from, holding these infected bones in your hands, you canapost help but feel sorry for Dolly, said Woodruff. Weaposve all experienced these same symptoms — coughing, trouble breathing, a fever, etc. — and hereaposs a -million-year-old dinosaur that likely felt as miserable as we all do when weaposre sick.Slightly closer to home, two years ago a visitor to Penarth beach in Glamorgan found what is now believed to be the extremely rare footprints of a dinosaur from more than  million years ago. Scientists have now revealed they believe the extremely rare tracks come from a time when the supercontinent Pangea was still intact. Initially, the tracks were thought to be part of the geological process of the beach and scientists were sceptical about them being footprints. But further evaluation indicated they were dinosaur tracks from the late Triassic period which is when dinosaurs began to reign supreme on Earth. Paul Barrett, anthropology palaeobiologist at the museum and co-author of the study, said in a statement: We believed the impressions we saw at Penarth were consistently spaced to suggest an animal walking. These types of tracks are not particularly common worldwide, so we believe this is an interesting addition to our knowledge of Triassic le in the U.K. Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON DinosaursMuseums" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: boy 8 sends adorably cheeky
story: Boy, , sends adorably cheeky letter to Tooth Fairy after swallowing his toothA little boy was left devastated when he swallowed one of his baby teeth while eating lunch - and decided to write a letter to the Tooth Fairy begging her to visitThe boy swallowed his tooth while eating pizzaImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Feb |comments We all know how the Tooth Fairy operates - when your tooth falls out, you place it under your pillow overnight and when you wake up in the morning, thereaposs a £ coin where your tooth was.But what happens when you lose a tooth, but you arenapost able to put it under your pillow  Thataposs what happened to one eight-year-old boy who accidentally swallowed his loose baby tooth while eating pizza for his lunch. He was left so panicked that heaposd miss the Tooth Fairyaposs visit, he decided to write her a note begging her to make an appearance anyway.His mum posted a picture of her sonaposs letter in a Facebook group, where she wrote: My son swallowed his wobbly tooth while eating pizza. He didnapost realise until he finished lunch. This is his Tooth Fairy letter.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. In the letter, the young boy initially pleaded with the Tooth Fairy to tell him what he should do about his swallowed tooth - before cheekily challenging the mythical creature to use an X-rayshe didnapost believe him. He wrote: Dear Tooth Fairy, I accidentally ate my tooth while I ate pizza! What should I do  If you donapost believe me, check my mouth or use an X-ray. Are you going to give me a £ still  The boyaposs hilarious message has left people in the comments on Facebook in stitches, as many praised him for offering the Tooth Fairy a good solution to his problem.One person said: I love the aposWHAT SHOULD I DOapos is written massive like a cry for help but then he crosses this out, calms down and gives her a solution. Thataposs hilarious. While another wrote: Aww bless! I hope the Tooth Fairy did a magic x-ray and gave this lovely child much-deserved £££££s. Heaposs definitely earned it from reading his cute note. And a third commented: I love how he had a big problem then he worked out some awesome solutions. Great le skills. While others also shared their own stories of children that have misplaced their baby teeth. Someone said: My grandson did this and we made a tooth out of bread to fool the Tooth Fairy. He was devastated, he swallowed it while eating crusty bread. As someone  added: My daughter swallowed a tooth and was so upset. I told her the Tooth Fairy was magic and could still get it. There are also certicates on google for a swallowed tooth so I printed that off. My daughter was incredibly happy to have both the money and a special certicate. Several commenters also asked for an update on the situation, and the mum confirmed that the Tooth Fairy did indeed still give him a £ coin.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Tooth FairyParentingViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: expert shares how many times
story: Expert shares how many times people should shower a week to protect their skinA dermatologist has taken to social media to share some expert advice that many of us desperately need to hear - and its bad news for those who take a shower every dayAn expert says youve been showering too much Image: Getty Images Image SourceByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb |commentsAn expert has said that people are showering too much and need to cut back - as washing every day could be damaging your skin.Lucy Chen is a dermatologist who has teamed up with Brightly, a sustainability organisation, to share some expert advice. She recently took to their TikTok to dispense some wisdom - but not everyone was ready to hear it.In the video, Lucy says that showering three or four times a week is fine but washing every day can strip your skin of essential oils and other nutrients. After hearing this, lots of viewers hit back, with many saying that there is no way theyaposre cutting back on showering.  What do you think is the right amount to shower  Let us know in the comments...Lucy, from Riverchase Dermatology, said: Showering every day may be bad for your skin because it can remove essential oils and dry out your skin.Dryness can lead to eczema or skin inflammation, or make your skin red and itchy.One of the main reasons for showering is to wash away dead skin cells, dirt, debris, and sweat. If you work up a sweat, you may want to shower that same day.  The amount you should shower really depends on your environment and your daily activities. aposaposShowering also depends on your natural tendencies toward sweating, oiliness, and body odor.In an interview with Brightly, Lucy went on to explain that washing too much can also be bad for your hair, cause acne, and may make allergies worse.But despite this, not everyone seemed keen to stop their daily showering habits. One TikTok user said: Living in a country that can get really hot I will pass on this. Summer is just too hot and sweaty to skip on showers.aposapos A second user added: Please disregard this message. Moisturize with clean ingredient products you’ll be alright. And a third wrote: I take extra long showers this season because it’s so cold.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: man blasted after being upgraded
story: Man blasted after being upgraded on long flight - as he left his we behindA man took to Reddit to share his story, saying he was blasted for accepting an upgrade on a -hour flight because he left his we in economy while he lived it up in business classA man has been blasted for accepting a flight upgrade and leaving his we in economy Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A man has been blasted after admitting he accepted an upgrade to business class on a -hour flight - as he left his we behind in economy.Sharing his story anonymously, the man said that his we wasnapost too happy with him as they had planned to sit next to each other for the whole flight. But, unknown to his we, the man had already accepted an upgrade - and didnapost see a problem with it as it was an overnight flight and theyaposd both be asleep anyway. He shared his story online and asked others for their opinion, and soon he was inundated with comments from people who said he was in the wrong for leaving his we. What would you have done in that scenario  Let us know in the comments...Taking to Reddit, the man said: So me and my we are going to the United States from Japan for a month for vacation, and when we booked the tickets, we initially thought that we were going to be sitting next to each other, but I had the option to upgrade my seat to business with miles and I did. Well, my we is not too happy about that because she wanted to sit together on the -hour flight, but it’s overnight so we’re gonna be sleeping the whole flight so I didn’t think it mattered. I told her that and she got upset because she thinks I chose business class over her and that’s rude apparently.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. I said to her that she’s just jealous and she got upset and told me to ask the airline to seeI can switch my seat back to economy. Despite explaining his story as carefully as he could, other Reddit users couldnapost help but take the weapos side. One said: Either upgrade both seats or neither, upgrading just yours comes across as very selfish. Then a second added: You literally ditched your we and then mocked her - she is completely right to be upset. title: man left unimpressed tesco sandwich
story: Man left unimpressed as Tesco sandwich misses out on a vital ingredientTaxi driver Colin McKenzies lunchtime meal may have been ruined after he found that one vital ingredient in his Tescos own brand smoked ham and cheddar meal deal sandwich was missingA man was shocked to discover he only got half a sandwich Image: REUTERSByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments A man was left surprised after buying a Tesco sandwich as it was lacking one vital ingredient - so he took to social media to complain.Colin McKenzie, a taxi driver, went to his local supermarket and picked up his favourite lunch - a smoked ham and cheddar sandwich.But when he sat down to eat it he was shocked, as his sandwich contained just bread, butter, and ham - lacking the advertised cheese, as the Daily Star reports. He shared his discovery on Twitter and was soon inundated with comments, and one said: You need to pay extra for the cheddar.  What do you think about Colinaposs faulty sandwich  Let us know in the comments...Colin, from Edinburgh, wrote online: “Hey @Tesco, whereaposs the cheddar ” His cheese-off tweet ended with a crying face emoji. Tesco did reply to the customer online, writing: I’m really sorry this has happened. Can you please DM us your full name, address  email along with pics of the packaging  The bar code, date code and the supplier codeand a picture of the receipt please. Thanks, Stuart.According to Tescoaposs own website, the sandwich is supposed to comprise slices of Beechwood smoked ham with mature cheddar and mayonnaise, and is made using a mixture of British and EU pork. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. However, some users on Twitter saw the funny side of the issue. Jsem Ozymandia tweeted: “You need to pay extra for the cheddar, you just bought the idea of it.” And another user posted: “FFS @Tesco, taking the p**s here”. Teco has been approached for comment.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it.
